Package com.foreach.across.modules.entity.web.links

Class EntityViewLinkBuilderSupport<T extends EntityViewLinkBuilderSupport<T>>

java.lang.Object
com.foreach.across.modules.entity.web.links.EntityViewLinkBuilderSupport<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
EntityViewLinkBuilder, SingleEntityViewLinkBuilder
public class EntityViewLinkBuilderSupport<T extends EntityViewLinkBuilderSupport<T>> extends Object
Base class for entity link builder implementations. Simply call toString() to get the URI String representation.
Since:
3.0.0
Author:
Arne Vandamme

    • slash

      public T slash(String path)
      Add a path segment to the URI.
      Parameters:
      path - segment to add
      Returns:
      new link builder instance

    • withPartial

      public T withPartial(String fragment)
      Add a _partial query string parameter to the URI.
      Parameters:
      fragment - partial fragment identifier
      Returns:
      new link builder instance

    • withFromUrl

      public T withFromUrl(String url)
      Add a from query string parameter to the URI.
      Parameters:
      url - original from url to set
      Returns:
      new link builder instance

    • withViewName

      public T withViewName(String viewName)
      Add a view query string parameter to the URI. Note: This will not perform any checking if that view actually exists.
      Parameters:
      viewName - name of the view
      Returns:
      new link builder instance

    • withQueryParam

      public T withQueryParam(String name, Object... values)
      Add a query parameter to the URI. This will replace a previously set value. Passing a single null value is the same as passing no values and will remove the query string parameter.
      Parameters:
      name - of the query string parameter
      values - for the parameter name
      Returns:
      new link builder instance

    • root

      public EntityViewLinks root()
      Return the root EntityViewLinks to link to a different entity type.
      Returns:
      links component

    • toUriString

      public String toUriString()
      Create a URI string of the configured link, this will resolve any path prefixes and will optionally encode the URL.
      Returns:
      string version of the URI, resolved version of toString()
